required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Emergency Department Vestibular Rehabilitation Therapy for Dizziness and Vertigo
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Feasibility Trial of Emergency Department Vestibular Rehabilitation Therapy for Dizziness and Vertigo

brief_summary.textblock: ED-VeRT will enroll up to 100 adult emergency department (ED) patients presenting with a chief complaint of dizziness or vertigo to collect longitudinal outcomes over 3 months of follow-up. This will include 50 patients who were evaluated by an ED physical therapist (ie, vestibular rehabilitation) during their ED visit and 50 patients who received usual care. The aims of this trial are to: (1) obtain initial estimates of participant recruitment and retention, intra-cluster correlation, and between-group outcome differences that will inform sample size calculation for a future randomized clinical trial, and (2) assess feasibility and fidelity of a clinical classification protocol for undifferentiated dizziness among patients receiving ED vestibular rehabilitation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Three months after the index ED visit.
primary_outcome.description: The DHI contains 25 items quantifying self-perceived handicapping effects of dizziness symptoms.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Three months after the index ED visit.
secondary_outcome.description: The VAAI-9 identifies fear avoidance beliefs in persons with dizziness. The VAAI-9 is the 9-item short form version of the VAAI.
The proportion of ED visits in which any diagnostic imaging of the brain was performed, including computed tomography and magnetic resonance imaging.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Index ED visit (up to one week)
secondary_outcome.description: Total length of stay, inclusive of hospitalizations and observation stays.

other_outcome.measure: Patient-Reported Medication Use in Last 24 Hours
other_outcome.time_frame: Three months after the index ED visit.
other_outcome.description: Patient-reported medication use for dizziness will be collected using a standardized instrument assess whether participants have taken any dizziness medication in the last 24 hours (binary yes/no). The 24-hour timeframe was selected to maximize accuracy in patient recall. In brief, dizziness medications are listed by brand and generic names; a "yes" response to any medication triggers an additional query asking the participant to specify the medication dose (e.g., meclizine 25mg) and quantity (e.g., one pill).

other_outcome.time_frame: Three months after the index ED visit.
other_outcome.description: The GROC is a single-item survey used to evaluate overall recovery from the time that symptoms began until now. Responses are provided on a 15-point Likert scale ranging from "a very great deal worse" to "a very great deal better."

other_outcome.time_frame: Three months after the index ED visit.
other_outcome.description: The NRS measures intensity of dizziness symptoms from 0 to 10. Participants will report average dizziness intensity over the last 24 hours.

other_outcome.time_frame: Three months after the index ED visit.
other_outcome.description: Proportion of participants who utilized any advanced healthcare resources for dizziness after their index ED visit, defined as advanced imaging (e.g., computed tomography, magnetic resonance imaging) or procedures/surgery.

arm_group.description: Patients in the ED physical therapy group will have been evaluated by an emergency department physical therapist for dizziness/vertigo during their index ED visit.
Patients in the usual care group will NOT have received an evaluation by an ED physical therapist for dizziness/vertigo symptoms during their index ED visit.

intervention.description: Vestibular Rehabilitation refers to the specific interventions that physical therapists provide to patients with dizziness and vertigo symptoms. These interventions can involve repositioning maneuvers, habituation exercises, gaze stabilization, and/or balance training exercises, depending on the specific etiology of dizziness and vertigo per an established clinical protocol utilizing a patient's history and exam findings. Physical therapists instruct patients in how to perform these exercises at home and provide instructions and referral for patients to follow-up with an outpatient physical therapist for further care.
Usual Care refers to any combination of diagnostic testing, medications, and patient education or counseling provided by a patient's treating ED physician.

study_pop.textblock: ED patients presenting with a chief complaint relating to dizziness or vertigo.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chief complaint relating to dizziness or vertigo
- Ability to complete follow-up data collection electronically or by telephone
- English-speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe neurologic deficit concerning for ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke
- Known pregnancy, under police custody, unable to consent
